Sébastien Lecornu, a prime minister in no hurry to form his government
subhead: More than two weeks after his appointment as prime minister, Sébastien Lecornu has chosen to 'put the what before the who,' by first defining his political orientations so that those who agree to join him share his goals.

Iran meets Europeans but no compromise over nuclear program as Tehran pushes back
subhead: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has until Saturday to reach a deal with his British, French, German and EU counterparts to avoid reinstatement of UN sanctions. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron said he will meet with Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian on Wednesday to continue talks.

title: Claudia Cardinale, the muse of Italian cinema, has died aged 87
subhead: Since her movie debut at the age of 14, she played roles of working-class and bourgeois women and bomb planters, without ever losing her modesty. She died at the age of 87 on Tuesday.

title: Trump's response to the crisis of multilateralism? A tirade
subhead: With bizarre accusations, mockery and untruths, on Tuesday, US President Donald Trump set out to undermine the credibility of the United Nations, an institution that he has contributed to weakening.

title: Alexus Grynkewich, top NATO commander in Europe: 'Russia has always tried to maneuver for advantage over the alliance'
subhead: As the repercussions of the war in Ukraine increasingly impact Europe, NATO's new supreme allied commander Europe explains the measures aimed at countering any actions that target NATO member states.
byline: Chloé Hoorman,  Elise Vincent and  Philippe Jacqué

Italy's 'anti-vax' movement is galvanized by Kennedy Jr
subhead: Ever since Robert F. Kennedy Jr was appointed as US health secretary, the scientific community has feared that skepticism of vaccines could spread to the rest of the world. In Italy, his influence has already become apparent.

title: 'On the Zucman tax, France is mired in a hysterical debate'
subhead: The right pretends not to see that the ultra-rich are not paying their fair share. The left, meanwhile, is blindly accepting an idea that is solely academic in nature, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: In Italy, tens of thousands hold protests in solidarity with Gaza
subhead: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets across Italy on Monday to 'condemn the genocide in Gaza,' during a day of protests marked by strikes and blockades organized by several unions, echoing the slogan of the French protest movement, Block Everything.
